title: Oyster Mushroom Thoran (Kerala)
instructions: 1. Heat coconut oil in a kadai and splutter mustard seeds, then add cumin seeds and curry leaves. 2. Sauté chopped onion, green chillies, and crushed garlic until the onion turns translucent. 3. Add sliced oyster mushrooms, turmeric, and salt; cook on medium heat for 3–4 minutes, stirring gently. 4. Mix in grated coconut, cover, and cook another 4–5 minutes until mushrooms are just tender. 5. Remove the lid, stir‑fry on high for 1 minute to evaporate excess moisture. Serve hot with rice or chapati.

title: Oyster Mushroom Varutharacha Curry (Kerala Roasted‑Coconut Gravy)
ingredients: 200 g oyster mushrooms, cut into bite‑sized pieces
instructions: 1. Dry‑roast grated coconut, coriander seeds, fennel, fenugreek, and dried chillies on low flame until deep brown; cool and grind with a splash of water to a smooth paste. 2. Heat coconut oil, add curry leaves and onions; sauté till lightly golden. 3. Add crushed ginger‑garlic, sauté 30 seconds, then add chopped tomato and turmeric; cook until tomato softens. 4. Stir in oyster mushrooms and salt; cook 3 minutes. 5. Pour thin coconut milk, cover, simmer 5 minutes. 6. Add the roasted‑coconut paste; simmer 4 minutes more until oil separates. 7. Finish with thick coconut milk, adjust salt, and switch off before it boils. Serve with steamed matta rice or appam.

title: Oyster Mushroom Pepper Fry (Kerala Toddy‑Shop Style)
ingredients: 200 g oyster mushrooms, torn into strips
instructions: 1. Marinate mushroom strips with turmeric, chilli powder, garam masala, and salt for 10 minutes. 2. Heat coconut oil; fry ginger, garlic, green chilli, and curry leaves till aromatic. 3. Add onions; sauté until edges brown. 4. Toss in marinated mushrooms; cook on high heat, stirring, until moisture evaporates and pieces get light char. 5. Sprinkle crushed pepper and vinegar; stir 1 minute. Taste, adjust salt, and serve as a spicy side or snack.

title: Oyster Mushroom Tikka Masala (North Indian)
ingredients: 200 g oyster mushrooms, kept whole if small
instructions: 1. Mix curd, ginger‑garlic paste, spices, salt, and oil; coat mushrooms, marinate 15 minutes. 2. Skewer or spread on a greased tray; grill/air‑fry 8–10 minutes at 200 °C until edges char. 3. Heat butter and oil; sauté onion purée till golden. 4. Add tomato purée, chilli powder, turmeric, salt; cook till fat separates. 5. Add ½ cup water, grilled mushrooms, garam masala; simmer 5 minutes. 6. Crush kasuri methi between palms, stir in with cream; cook 1 minute. Garnish with coriander; pair with naan or jeera rice.

title: Oyster Mushroom Chettinad (Spicy South‑Indian Dry Curry)
instructions: 1. Dry‑roast fennel, cumin, peppercorns, red chillies, coriander, and poppy seeds; cool and grind to a coarse powder. 2. Heat oil; add curry leaves and onion, sauté till golden. 3. Add ginger‑garlic paste; cook out raw smell. 4. Stir in tomatoes and turmeric; cook till mushy. 5. Add spice powder, sauté 30 seconds, then mushrooms and salt. 6. Cook on medium‑high, tossing, until mushrooms shrink and masala coats well (6–7 minutes). Garnish with coriander; serve with kuzhi paniyaram or rice.

title: Indo‑Chinese Oyster Mushroom Chilli Stir‑Fry
ingredients: ¼ cup water + ½ tsp cornflour (slurry)
instructions: 1. Toss mushrooms with cornflour, flour, pepper, and salt; sprinkle few drops water to coat. 2. Shallow‑fry in hot oil until light golden; drain. 3. In a wok, heat 1 tbsp oil; sauté garlic, ginger, spring onion whites, and green chilli for 30 seconds. 4. Add capsicum; stir‑fry 1 minute. 5. Return fried mushrooms; add soy sauce, chilli sauce, and vinegar. 6. Pour cornflour slurry, toss quickly over high flame until sauce thickens and glazes mushrooms. 7. Garnish with spring‑onion greens; serve immediately as a snack or with fried rice.
